goods.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: things that are produced in order to be sold
goods.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: the large market for consumer goods (=televisions, washing machines etc)
Britain’s leading exporter of manufactured goods (=things that are made, not grown)
There will be tax increases on a range of goods and services.
goods.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: things that someone owns and that can be moved
goods.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: They were charged with handling stolen goods.
We collected up our goods and left.
goods.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: things which are carried by road, train etc
goods.translation[0].note_box[0].section: Today's shoppers are spending more money on mobile phones and electrical goods than on clothing.
Household goods are downstairs in the basement.
The market for consumer goods is huge.
Imports of manufactured goods have increased rapidly.
The United States became a major exporter of agricultural goods.
The new industrial middle classes began to demand luxury goods.
What is the permitted amount of duty-free goods?
The house is unfurnished, except for white goods.
The company has 22 percent of the total market for brown goods.
Perishable goods are transported in refrigerated trucks.
Consumers have a right to reasonable protection against the sale of faulty goods.
The police charged him with handling stolen goods.
Counterfeit goods will be seized and traders will face prosecution.
All his worldly goods fit in four packing cases.
The company provides a range of specialized goods and services.
The company started a factory in Singapore, to produce goods for export.
Local industries were created to manufacture goods that were previously imported.
Western Europe is the world’s second largest market for imported goods.
The company exports Thai goods to Europe.
On 3 September he supplied goods to the hotel valued at £350.00.
goods.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: things that are produced in order to be used or sold
goods.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: North Korea has no hard currency reserves to buy goods.
The strike is expected to delay payments to companies that sell goods to the government.
Suppliers have refused to ship goods since the company filed for bankruptcy last month.
If Mexico develops its economy, it will export goods and not its workers.
Manaus became a free-trade zone where companies could freely import goods and components.
goods.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: heavy things that are carried by road, train etc
goods.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The report criticises the transport industry for the distances over which goods are moved by road.
